title: RS21055
content: This report provides a brief summary of the last round of NATO enlargement. The report analyzes the key military and political issues in the debate over seven prospective members named atNATO'sPrague summit. It then provides an overview of the positions of the allies and of Russia on enlargement, citing theeffectsof the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, on the United States. It concludes with a discussion of recentlegislation onenlargement. This report will be updated as needed. See also CRS Report RS21354, The NATO Summit atPrague, 2002,CRS Report RL30168, NATO Applicant States: A Status Report, and CRS Report RS21510,NATO's Decision-MakingProcedure.
